title: Linux Permissions & Ownership
description: Fix 'Permission Denied' errors and file ownership problems on Linux systems.

steps.title: Check Current Permissions
steps.instruction: Run 'ls -l <filename>'. Identify the owner, group, and permission bits (rwx).

steps.title: Change File Ownership
steps.instruction: Use 'sudo chown yourusername:yourusername <filename>' to take ownership of a file that belongs to root.

steps.title: Modify Permission Bits
steps.instruction: Use 'chmod 644' for files and 'chmod 755' for directories. Avoid 'chmod 777' as it is a major security risk.

steps.title: Check Sudoers File
steps.instruction: If sudo fails: 'sudo -l'. Ensure your user is in the 'sudo' or 'wheel' group.

steps.title: Identify Blocked Process
steps.instruction: If a service can't write: 'grep -i deny /var/log/audit/audit.log' to check for SELinux or AppArmor blocks.
